medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The symptoms progressed leading to a diagnosis of preeclampsia and HELLP syndrome, identified during the patient's admission at 33 weeks of gestation. Blood pressure was recorded at 194/120 mmHg. Treatment included magnesium sulfate and nicardipine without adequate control of blood pressure.
medical_history.past_medical_history: A history of amblyopia and hearing loss; postnatal respiratory distress requiring two months of tracheal intubation. Fetal echography during pregnancy suggested a cleft palate. A previous CT scan showed mild scoliosis.
